descriptionText.text:
Description

Upwind is the runtime-powered CNAPP that leverages runtime data to secure our customers’ cloud infrastructure. Upwind’s comprehensive approach to cloud security helps organizations mitigate the risks that actually matter, identify the root causes of threats in minutes and respond with context and automation. Upwinders are spread across the globe in all departments and work together to protect the infrastructure of our customers - we’re a strong, emerging player in a massive and growing market, and it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Upwind, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth.

We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join our great Backend Engineering team.The team faces complex engineering issues on a daily basis, both solving new challenges and constantly improving the existing solutions.We work with all major cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure) and use cutting-edge technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker, Neo4j, ElasticSearch, Redis, TimescaleDB, RabbitMQ, and more.

Responsibilities

Responsible for the entire lifecycle of the project, from initial design and development to deployment, monitoring and maintenance in the production environmentContributing to technical and architectural decisionsConducting design and code reviewsAnalyzing and improving efficiency, scalability, and stability of various backend system componentsInterfacing with other teams (e.g. Frontend, DevOps) to deliver best-in-class features

Requirements

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science/Software Engineering or related field1+ years of experience with Backend Engineering in a high-level programming language (e.g. Golang, Java, C#, Python, Node.js)Experience with cloud platforms and products (e.g. AWS, GCP and Azure)Experience implementing data-intensive systems (databases, event systems, messaging systems, etc)Experience with continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD)Experience with microservices based architecture

Who we areAllot is an industry leader in network security and visibility. A global growing company in cyber-security with a strong Tier1 customer base. We embrace an Agile way of working, priding ourselves on being fast, diverse and dynamic. We are real team players who are ready to go the extra mile to succeed. We believe that anyone can make an impact and together our team spirit makes all the difference. This is your opportunity to develop, professionally and personally.
What we are looking forAllot Software Engineers develop the next-generation technologies that secure and monitor the network.Our products need to handle network traffic even fully encrypted.We are looking for talented engineer who bring high motivation and desire to and work as software developers together with our research team to help improving our infrastructure for our AI.This position will start as a temporary project for 6-9 months with possibility to expend. It will be given the option for a temporary contract or university agreement.
What you will doYou will work together with our research team to improve the infrastructure and optimize the data collection as an input for our AI models.You will build the tool to collect, clean and process this information.
What you should haveDegree in Computer Science or TelecommunicationsHighly motivated team player with great collaboration skills.Great written & verbal communication skills.Some understanding of network architecture and protocols.Experience in design and coding with Python.Experience with Linux OS environment.

Was Sie erwarten können:Einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz in einer am Markt etablierten und stetig wachsenden KanzleiEin gutes und kollegiales ArbeitsklimaEine moderne Ausstattung (elektronische Akte)Eine leistungsgerechte Bezahlung
Was wir erwarten:Freude am Beruf des RechtsanwaltesDie Qualifikation als Fachanwalt für Verkehrsrecht und/oder Miet- und WEG-Recht bzw. Bereitschaft, diese zu erwerbenEngagement, für die Interessen des Mandanten zu streiten
Es ist nicht zwingend erforderlich, dass Sie bereits über Berufserfahrung verfügen. Wenn Sie Berufsanfänger sind, helfen wir Ihnen und führen Sie dabei so bald wie möglich an die selbständige Bearbeitung von Mandaten heran. Bei Interesse an weiteren Rechtsgebieten werden wir dies natürlich fördern.
Rechtsanwälte Wittenberg und KollegenDrususallee 16-1841460 Neuss

Dlaczego My?Jesteśmy częścią grupy ALTEN – wiodącego, europejskiego dostawcy usług doradztwa inżynieryjnego i technologicznego. W ciągu 30 lat staliśmy się głównym partnerem technologicznym wielu globalnych klientów, zatrudniając przy tym ponad 42 000 pracowników (w tym 88% inżynierów), w 30 krajach na całym świecie. Wspieramy strategie rozwoju swoich klientów w dziedzinie innowacji, badań i rozwoju oraz systemów informatycznych, osiągając przychody przekraczające 2,92 mld euro.
Zostaliśmy wyróżnieni tytułem Great Place to Work 2023 oraz nagrodą „Rzecznik Standardu Etyki” przyznawaną przez United Nations Global Compact Network Poland.
Nasza dewiza to – „You Grow, We Grow!”Dołącz do ALTEN Polska i rośnij razem z nami!
Nasze wymagania:Dostępność ASAP/2 tygodniePraca hybrydowa w Warszawie (3 dni z biura, 2 dni zdalnie)Doświadczenie ponad 3 letnie z projektami z JavąDoświadczenie ze Spring BootemZnajomość i doświadczenie w zakresie tworzenia podstawowych aplikacji MS Azure
Twoje zadania:Budowanie, testowanie i wdrażanie oprogramowania przy wykorzystaniu CI/CDTworzenie mikroserwisów do przetwarzania danychTestowanie oprogramowania pod kątem stosowania, jakości, zgodności na awarie, wydajności i skalowalnościUruchamianie aplikacji, rozwiązywanie problemów i zapewnianie, że działanie jest bezbłędneWłączanie funkcji bezpieczeństwa do rozwiązań, takich jak autoryzacja i uwierzytelnianie, kontrola dostępu 
Oferujemy:-Możliwość wyboru rodzaju kontraktu: B2B lub umowa o pracę -Stabilną i długoterminową współpracę -Jasno zdefiniowaną ścieżkę kariery u europejskiego lidera w doradztwie inżynieryjnym i IT -Udział w konferencjach branżowych, szkoleniach i warsztatach oraz spotkaniach integracyjnych -Możliwość odbycia kursów i zdobycia certyfikacji -Możliwość relokacji w ramach lokalnych oddziałów ALTEN Polska -Współpracę z dedykowanym Business Development Managerem-Pracę w firmie z certyfikatem #GreatPlaceToWork -Prywatna opieka medyczna Medicover -Prywatna opieka dentystyczna Medicover -Platforma zakupowa Medicover Benefits / karta sportowa Medicover -Program poleceń pracowników ALTEN Talenty -Dostęp do platformy e-learningowej -Wyprawka dla nowonarodzonego dziecka pracownika -Ubezpieczenie grupowe na życie -Możliwość udziału w programie emerytalnym 
Nie czekaj i dołącz do naszego zespołu!
UWAGA: Uprzejmie informujemy, że skontaktujemy się z wybranymi osobami.

Nimble One is a robotic startup, located in Toulouse, France.
We are looking for a Lead electronic engineer to lead the electrical engineering team as we bring Aru's electronic into its industrialisation phase.This is a high profile position where you'll be expected to add critical value to the project. Therefore a relocation package is available as well as stock options.
We are building Aru, a novel mobile robot capable of advanced interactions. Aru is made for challenging terrains, constrained and tight spaces, with its main goal being to bring the right tool at the right place, where other robots cannot go.
With the recent reveal of our pre-series prototype Aru V3, we are starting our next an biggest challenge yet : Industrialization and field deployments as part of our early-adopter program.As part of this, we are expanding our platform team with several key roles.
As lead electronic engineer, the technical challenges you'll be managing :PCBs with high-tech communication protocols : Ethercat, Ethernet, USB, ...PCBs with advanced electronics : fiber optics, acurate distributed sensors, slip rings ...Custom sub-assemblies where a smart system design is key : Custom actuator and controller boards, ...(Depending on skills & preferences) Embedded firmware : motor control, distributed computations, ...
As well as dedicated mission tools that must embedded well into the modular structure of Aru to specialize for each use-case. Which will entail a large amount of custom mechanical, electrical and firmware engineering.
We are looking for someone with more than 10 years of experience. Like all jobs at Nimble One, this is a hands-on job where you'll design, source and order, prototype, debug and improve the projects you are working on, as part of a larger team. 
You want to build a unprecedented robot with world class functionality, full of state of the art technology ? That's Aru, by Nimble One.

BindingFuture, azienda del Gruppo Teoresi, è specializzata nello sviluppo software e consulenza informatica.Realizziamo soluzioni software personalizzate per conto dei nostri Clienti, in ambito web, cloud, mobile, desktop, IoT, bot e assistenti vocali. 
BindingFuture è alla ricerca di un giovane Software Developer, orientato allo sviluppo sulla piattaforma Microsoft .NET. 
La persona selezionata verrà inserita in un gruppo di lavoro fortemente orientato all'innovazione e si occuperà di progetti di sviluppo variegati per settore e tecnologia impiegata.
Requisiti richiesti: • Laurea in ambito informatico o esperienza equivalente • Seniority: 1/2 anni • Passione e interesse per lo sviluppo in ambiente .NET 
Skill tecniche: • C# • Framework .NET • ASP.NET Core • SQL • Git 
Completano il profilo: • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese • Entusiasmo per la tecnologia BindingFuture offre: • Percorsi di certificazione Microsoft • Supporto per lo studio e il conseguimento degli esami Microsoft • Possibilità di lavorare in progetti e tecnologie di vario tipo
Il candidato potrà evolvere le proprie competenze su tecnologie che normalmente utilizziamo, ovvero: • Cloud Azure • Microservices • Docker • Kubernetes • Xamarin • MAUI • Blazor • NoSQL 
La sede di lavoro è Milano/Cologno Monzese con alta flessibilità per il remote working.
Si informano i candidati che, inviando la candidatura, tutti i dati verranno trattati secondo quanto previsto dalla nostra informativa privacy, visionabile al seguente link https://www.teoresigroup.com/privacy-notice-recruitment/.

Created in 2016, Meero is the world expert in image quality, providing the best end-to-end visual content solutions for online sellers.
From fashion professional photography to AI-based image management and quality enhancement, we’re here to analyze, optimize and beautify all visuals in order to boost online sales.
At the crossroads of AI and creativity, Meero partners with players in diverse industries (Real Estate, Automotive, Fashion...) all around the world.
www.meero.com / www.car-cutter.com
Missions
Position Overview
Location: Paris (France) or Graz (Austria)
CarCutter is our global #1 visual AI editing and optimisation solution for the automotive industry and is used by customers from all around the world.
CarCutter is seeking a talented and experienced Backend Engineer Manager to lead our backend team. In this critical role, you will be responsible for overseeing all backend operations.As a hands-on leader, you will not only oversee the technical direction but also actively contribute to coding and system design, leveraging your expertise to foster innovation and excellence within the team. Your leadership will play a key role in achieving excellence in our services and maintaining our position as the number one visual AI editing and optimization solution in the automotive industry.
Key Responsibilities
You will be responsible for:
Team Leadership and Development: Lead a team of 3-5 Backend developers, ensuring effective onboarding, continuous training, and performance management. Foster a culture of innovation and collaboration.
Hands-On Technical Leadership: Directly engage in coding and problem-solving, embody a "lead by example" approach to uphold high standards and foster innovation within the team.
Code Quality: Promote and ensure the production of clean, efficient, and well-tested code. Mentor team members in adhering to best coding practices.
Backend Architecture: Drive the enhancement of our backend architecture to ensure scalability, efficiency, and innovation.
Ownership and Management: Take ownership of critical backend components such as APIs, processing pipelines, and feature development. Ensure the integrity and reliability of these components.
CI/CD Pipeline: Maintain and optimize the CI/CD pipeline for seamless integration, testing, and deployment of code.
Feature Planning: Lead the architectural design and planning of new features in alignment with product goals and customer needs.
Technical Debt and AWS Management: Address technical debt proactively and manage AWS services to ensure our infrastructure supports our operational and growth requirements efficiently.
Profil
Minimum of 5+ years in backend engineering and 2+ years in management.Bachelor's or Master's in Computer Science, Engineering, or related.Expert in Python, software architecture, and familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).Expert-level experience in developing backend systems on a scale with a DevOps mindsetStrong problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.Strong English communication skills, both written and verbal.Eager to learn, explore and take actions
Dev @Meero 
We are ambitious and we set challenging objectives for ourselvesWe grow strong, we’re aiming at getting the best talents to work with usWe are a team of passionate people, with a strong emphasis on collaboration
Hiring Process A first call with a member of our Talent Acquisition TeamFirst Technical Assessment to assess your knowledge in PythonVideo call with our Engineering manager team to get to know each other and to learn more about the role and our tech culture.Second Technical Assessment which mirrors the real job at CarCutter (Q&A format)Final interview with the CEOWelcome aboard!

Chaos is the world’s largest 3D visualization software company, and for over 20 years has empowered artists, designers, and architects to visualize anything they can imagine. Chaos offers intuitive and powerful workflows for creatives across the entire design spectrum, including architecture, engineering, construction, product design, manufacturing, and media and entertainment. Research and development at Chaos is leading the way towards a truly comprehensive end-to-end visualization ecosystem to meet the evolving needs of existing and new customers. In 2022, Chaos merged with Enscape and acquired Cylindo. For more information, visit chaos.com, enscape3d.com, and cylindo.com.
Chaos Camp is Chaos’ annual programming academy for junior developers interested in gaining the coding knowledge and skills essential for a career in software development for computer graphics. The academy is organized in partnership with MNKnowledge - a trusted provider of educational services in the field of information technology.
***The program is open for applicants based in Bulgaria, Czechia, Denmark, and Germany. Although the training will be conducted online, the best-performing participants will have the opportunity to join the Chaos team, which will require on-site presence in our offices in these locations: Sofia, Bulgaria; Prague, Czechia; Copenhagen, Denmark; Karlsruhe, Germany.***
What we offer:Intensive 3.5-month free-of-charge online training focused on algorithms and data structures for C++ and computer graphics programming. The training sessions will be conducted in English, starting on April 2, 2024, and continuing until mid-July.Training and mentorship by lecturers from our partner MNKnowledge and senior professionals from the Chaos team.Chance to learn more about the software development world and 3D visualization by collaborating with members of the Chaos team.Certificate of Completion issued by Chaos, awarded upon the successful completion of the course (80%+ lectures attended, 80%+ homework assignments completed).Opportunity to become a part of the Chaos team and further develop your skills by receiving additional lectures in C++ algorithms and machine learning, as well as on-the-job training.
What do you need to successfully enroll in Chaos Camp?Working level of English (B1);Interest in mathematical algorithms and/or computer graphics;Relevant education/courses in the field of software development;Commitment to attend the training sessions and complete the homework assignments;Proactivity and passion for learning.
Don't miss the opportunity to participate in this year's edition of the Chaos Camp and send us your CV in English with attached/linked projects demonstrating your software development skills by March 17, 2024.
Please make sure you get familiar with our Privacy Policy before applying. (https://static.chaos.com/documents/assets/000/000/441/original/Privacy-Notice-Chaos-Engineering-Camp-2024.docx.pdf?1708520701)
Only short-listed candidates will be contacted via email to complete the entry test prior to the beginning of the course. The candidates with the highest score on the entry test will be invited to join the program.
Confidentiality of all applications is assured.

Wir bei wehorse.com möchten jedem die Möglichkeit geben, sich von überall auf der Welt rund um das Thema Pferd und Pferdesport weiterzubilden. 
Unsere Vision ist es, Menschen und Pferden dabei zu helfen, besser zu werden – mit den besten Trainern und mit erstklassigen Inhalten, die gleichzeitig Spaß machen und durch gute Erklärungen wirklich funktionieren. 
Eine Reitstunde mit Olympiasiegerin Ingrid Klimke oder ein paar Tipps von Lisa Röckener zur Freiarbeit sind bei uns an der Tagesordnung. Auf unserer Web- und Mobile-App finden neben hunderten videobasierten Onlinekursen auch regelmäßige Livestreaming-Events statt, sowie Deutschlands größter Pferdepodcast. 
Die Videos und Video-Kurse sind das Herzstück unseres Produkts. Du möchtest Videos und Kurse konzipieren, umsetzen und in der Postproduktion zu einem fertigen Produkt werden lassen, das von tausenden Menschen monatlich verwendet wird? Du hast Lust, mit uns neue Content-Formate zu entwickeln und du hast die neuesten Trends im Blick? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf uns dabei, coole Inhalte für Pferdemenschen zu erstellen, die ihnen dabei helfen, mit ihren Pferden besser zu werden.
Was sind deine Aufgaben?
Umsetzung von Content-Projekten im Bereich Lehrvideos und EdutainmentKonzeption und Erstellung hochwertiger Videos und Texte für unsere unterschiedlichen Content-Typen (Shorts, Kurse, SuperKurse und weitere) Postproduktion (Videos, Podcasts etc.) inklusive VideoschnittEnge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Marketing- und Social Media-Team, um sicherzustellen, dass der Content die Unternehmensziele unterstütztAnalyse von Content-Performance-Daten zur kontinuierlichen Optimierung der Content-StrategieAktives Beobachten von Trends im Bereich Video-Creation und Social Media, um neue Ideen und Ansätze zu integrieren
Stellenanforderungen
Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Medien und Kommunikation (Medienmanagement, Bewegtbild, Medienproduktion, Social Media etc.) oder vergleichbare AusbildungIdealerweise Berufserfahrung in der Content-Erstellung oder in einem verwandten BereichSicherer Umgang mit den gängigen Tools wie Adobe Premiere Pro, Capcut oder ähnlichenPferdewissen und Passion für Themen rund ums Pferd, idealerweise selbst Reiter*inHohe Affinität für soziale Medien und Trends im Bereich Content CreationStarkes Gespür für Qualität in Text und BildspracheLiebe fürs Detail aber auch die Fähigkeit, pragmatisch zu denken und zu handelnAusgezeichnete Schreib- und KommunikationsfähigkeitenKreativität und InnovationsfreudeTeamfähigkeit und FlexibilitätIdealerweise Englisch fließend in Sprache und Schrift
Es handelt sich um eine Vollzeit-Stelle (40h/Woche), die du grundsätzlich von überall antreten kannst. Du musst nicht zwangsläufig in Hamburg wohnen. Allerdings gibt es gewisse Zeiten im Büro, bei denen es wichtig ist, dass du präsent bist. Der Einstieg ist ab sofort möglich.

Für unseren Mandanten ein nachhaltiges und wachstumsorientiertes Unternehmen der Dienstleistungsbranche im Raum Frankfurt suchen wir in Festanstellung einen Senior Referent Konzernrechnungswesen (mwd) der unter anderem neu erworbene Gesellschaften integriert und als rechte Hand des Finance Directors agiert.
Im Wesentlichen erwarten Sie folgende Aufgaben:Koordination und Verantwortung der Monats-, Quartals- und Jahresabschlüsse Bilanzanalysen und Konsolidierung der Einzelabschlüsse im Wesentlichen nach HGB aber auch nach internationalen Rechnungslegunsgvorschriften Erstellung der ReportingpackagesOptimierung und Gestaltung von ProzessenEnge Zusammenarbeit mit der M&A AbteilungBegleitung von finanzrelevanten Integrationsprozessen nach UnternehmenszukäufenAnsprechpartner für Fragestellungen im Bereich Konzernrechnungswesen

Reconocida como la empresa líder en desarrollo de software, nuestro cliente ofrece una modalidad 100% remota y un excelente entorno de trabajo donde los empleados pueden prosperar y trabajar en equipos multiculturales con horarios flexibles e infinitas oportunidades de crecimiento.
Acerca del puesto:
Únete a nuestro dinámico equipo como Líder Técnico Java y lidera la innovación en un entorno colaborativo. Mejorarás los servicios, las herramientas y los componentes dentro de un equipo de colaboración mediante la conducción de soluciones ágiles para los desafíos internos y externos, garantizando una calidad de software de primera categoría. Conviértete en una pieza clave de nuestro equipo central, utilizando tecnologías modernas para dar forma a los artefactos y apoyar a diversos grupos, todo ello garantizando que nuestro software alcance nuevas cotas de excelencia.
Responsabilidades:
- Crear código eficiente, optimizado y mantenible utilizando Java.- Proponer soluciones creativas empleando múltiples tecnologías.- Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinares para diseñar arquitecturas en la nube utilizando Azure y Kubernetes, garantizando un despliegue fluido de las aplicaciones.- Garantizar el rendimiento de las aplicaciones estableciendo mecanismos de supervisión y alerta.- Aprovechar la arquitectura en la nube para diseñar e integrar API en un entorno de integración continua y revisión de código.- Dirigir y orientar a los desarrolladores junior.
Requisitos:
- Más de 5 años de experiencia en desarrollo Java.- Dominio de AWS.- Experiencia demostrada en el diseño de soluciones en la nube y la integración de servicios distribuidos.- Familiaridad con tecnologías de monitorización y alertas.- Experiencia con modelos de integración continua y revisión de código.- Gran capacidad de resolución de problemas.- Tener fluidez en español.- Nivel medio de inglés.
Beneficios:
- 100% trabajo a distancia.- Horario flexible - ¡haz tu propio horario!- Entorno de trabajo diverso y multicultural.- Permiso parental retribuido, vacaciones y festivos.- Hardware preparado para trabajar desde casa. - Excelente remuneración, muy por encima de la media del mercado.- Amplias oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional gracias a nuestro sistema de mentores.
Disfrute de la oportunidad de tener un estilo de vida dinámico, mejor salud y bienestar. Encuentre una pasión renovada en su trabajo, mejore su productividad y benefíciese de atractivas oportunidades de crecimiento para su carrera profesional.
Si estás interesado en formar parte de un equipo compuesto por los mejores profesionales y trabajar 100% orientado a objetivos en un entorno innovador, pero con la estructura y los recursos de una multinacional líder en el mercado, ¡no dudes en presentar tu candidatura!

Create moments that matter. Decode the future.

At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.

Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.

Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!

All about the role:

As software is playing an increasingly significant role in enabling digital consumer experiences, we are gearing up to become more agile, faster in responding to market demands and quicker in identifying new market opportunities. This involves elevating our appliances to digital, software-defined products in a seamless integration of modular electronics, software, and connectivity platform.

We’re looking for Backend Developer to join us on our journey.

What you'll do:

The main role responsibility will be to develop IoT oriented services. Standing in this role you will have the chance to work on the kernel of the IoT system of Electrolux, the system that must be able to manage a huge number of devices and with extremely high level of reliability and performances. The full value chain of the IoT application flows and depends on the IoT Platform part therefore, standing in the centre of the IoT system, this role can leverage all the opportunity and challenges coming with that.

In detail, you will:

 You will be designing/writing/testing microservices in a cloud environment. You will be automating deployment and monitoring of cloud services. You will be troubleshooting performance and functional issues related to cloud services. Time to time you will do this also in situation where app and connected devices are involved in cooperation with team members and other teams in the company. You will be training yourself to the latest cloud technologies and try to constantly improve yourself and the team you are part of.

Requirements:

 You know and you like programming cloud services and you want to do it at the best possible quality level. You are fluent with at least one API framework in either Java or .NET. You are fluent with at least one cloud provider between Azure and AWS. You are curious to find ways to optimize your work, process and tools. You know the challenges and the beauty of being part of a diverse distributed development team. You are willing to take new challenges and learn also new technologies that can be beneficial for the company.

You demonstrate:

 Collaboration - contributes to a highly collaborative environment that enables a cross functional team to flourish. Communication - effectively exchanges information and ideas with confidence and respect, able to demonstrate progress, raise issues and articulate changes on a frequent basis. Empathy - can understand and acknowledge the emotions and perspectives of others during conversations. Problem-Solving - able to connect the dots between insights, strategy, and conceptual direction; is outcome - as opposed to task - orientated. Adaptability & Resilience - can effectively navigate change, challenges, and setbacks while maintaining a positive and flexible approach. Proactivity - eager to learn and grow, sees challenges as opportunities, seeks and - is responsive to - feedback. Responsibility - accountable, reliable, and proactive in building systems and handling dependencies, contributing to a trustworthy and effective team dynamic.

Where you'll be:

This is a full-time position, based in Porcia.

Benefits highlights:

 Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services Family friendly benefits Insurance policy plan Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path

As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.

Find out more on:

Electrolux Group: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux

Italy: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/649881a8-78d7-48bc-b692-4b6ccc70b6b9

Reconocida como la empresa líder en desarrollo de software, nuestro cliente ofrece una modalidad 100% remota y un excelente entorno de trabajo donde los empleados pueden prosperar y trabajar en equipos multiculturales con horarios flexibles e infinitas oportunidades de crecimiento.
Acerca del puesto:
Únete a nuestro dinámico equipo como Líder Técnico Java y lidera la innovación en un entorno colaborativo. Mejorarás los servicios, las herramientas y los componentes dentro de un equipo de colaboración mediante la conducción de soluciones ágiles para los desafíos internos y externos, garantizando una calidad de software de primera categoría. Conviértete en una pieza clave de nuestro equipo central, utilizando tecnologías modernas para dar forma a los artefactos y apoyar a diversos grupos, todo ello garantizando que nuestro software alcance nuevas cotas de excelencia.
Responsabilidades:
- Crear código eficiente, optimizado y mantenible utilizando Java.- Proponer soluciones creativas empleando múltiples tecnologías.- Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinares para diseñar arquitecturas en la nube utilizando Azure y Kubernetes, garantizando un despliegue fluido de las aplicaciones.- Garantizar el rendimiento de las aplicaciones estableciendo mecanismos de supervisión y alerta.- Aprovechar la arquitectura en la nube para diseñar e integrar API en un entorno de integración continua y revisión de código.- Dirigir y orientar a los desarrolladores junior.
Requisitos:
- Más de 5 años de experiencia en desarrollo Java.- Dominio de AWS.- Experiencia demostrada en el diseño de soluciones en la nube y la integración de servicios distribuidos.- Familiaridad con tecnologías de monitorización y alertas.- Experiencia con modelos de integración continua y revisión de código.- Gran capacidad de resolución de problemas.- Tener fluidez en español.- Nivel medio de inglés.
Beneficios:
- 100% trabajo a distancia.- Horario flexible - ¡haz tu propio horario!- Entorno de trabajo diverso y multicultural.- Permiso parental retribuido, vacaciones y festivos.- Hardware preparado para trabajar desde casa. - Excelente remuneración, muy por encima de la media del mercado.- Amplias oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional gracias a nuestro sistema de mentores.
Disfrute de la oportunidad de tener un estilo de vida dinámico, mejor salud y bienestar. Encuentre una pasión renovada en su trabajo, mejore su productividad y benefíciese de atractivas oportunidades de crecimiento para su carrera profesional.
Si estás interesado en formar parte de un equipo compuesto por los mejores profesionales y trabajar 100% orientado a objetivos en un entorno innovador, pero con la estructura y los recursos de una multinacional líder en el mercado, ¡no dudes en presentar tu candidatura!

Working for Open CosmosAim high, go beyond!At Open Cosmos we are solving the world’s biggest challenges from space, providing businesses, governments and researchers access to more readily available information than ever before - ready for the challenge? Then read on…
Working in the Ground Segment TeamJoin our dynamic Ground SegmentTeam responsible for all of the on-ground software used to operate a fleet of Open Cosmos satellites. As a "new space" company, we embrace flexible agile development methodologies and DevOps practices.
Our cloud-native web application, OpenApp, is built with modern technologies like microservices, Kubernetes, and Go. Our image processing pipeline is built on a modern workflow system, with the jobs written in Python. You'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the product, from functionality to quality and maintainability. Join us and develop your skills in a modern cloud-based web application environment.
What will you be doing?As our software solutions, like our data platform DataCosmos, rapidly gain commercial traction, you’ll be responsible for delivering new software modules, through design, implementation, testing, deployment and maintenance, in addition to looking after existing services. Throughout this process, you’ll follow best practices for developing clean code and maintainable software and push for all the team to do the same.
You’ll have the opportunity to be involved in all points of the product development process, standing for yourself in the customer’s shoes and using that understanding to contribute to a roadmap & build software that leads to products that our customers love. Since we are always discovering new requirements for this software, you’ll be continually learning in order to deliver on those requirements.
In pursuit of our shared goal to keep improving, you’ll constantly be evaluating how we work & deliver to bring ideas/suggestions to the team - this can include e.g. platform & observability aspects for better reliability, streamlining our development & testing practices, or features/redesigns of the product itself.
What you need to be successfulAt Open Cosmos, we are more interested in what you can do than being dogmatic about your background! We’d love to take a look at your CV even if you’re not sure you tick all the boxes.
You’ll need: Program in the Go or Python programming language, including using common idioms of each language and testing frameworks. For Go, you should be familiar with goroutines and debugging race conditionsDesign, implement and maintain microservices using Docker, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, HTTP REST, gRPC and RabbitMQBuild and manage GitLab CI/CD pipelinesFollow best practices for developing maintainable and easy to understand software as well as in agile software development methodologiesCommunicate clearly and concisely, listening effectively, getting to the core of messages and responding appropriately
What we offer: Prefer to mostly WFH, that's fine! Need to take 30 mins at 3pm to get the kids from school? Go ahead! We're more interested in your contributions than when and where you're working.25 Days holiday in addition to national holidays.Having a successful team makes a successful company. We're at the forefront of technology so learning and building an enabling career for you is central to OC!

Responsibilities:Designing, developing, and implementing navigation algorithms and systems to meet product requirements.Collaborating with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate navigation systems into our products.Conducting rigorous testing and validation of navigation systems to ensure reliability and accuracy.Analyzing and troubleshooting navigation system performance to identify and resolve issues.Staying up to date with the latest advancements in navigation technology and incorporating them into our systems.Conducting research and establishing communication channels with GNSS vendors to ensure the use of the latest and most accurate navigation technology.

Welcome to Bosch

Cars drive autonomously, machines speak to each other, and houses become smarter. At Bosch, we turn these visions into reality to improve the quality of life for people all over the world. Start something big and become a part of forward thinkers where you can create something remarkable: Invented for life.

With over 300 specialized associates and around 15 nationalities, Bosch activities in Lisbon are focusing on sales, marketing, communication, training, nearshoring services and shared support for human resources services to Europe. The diversity, commitment and know-how of the team are the key success factors of this organization.

Bosch Service Solutions develops and delivers Customer Experience, Mobility and Monitoring solutions for companies and their customers. Our teams find fast and efficient solutions for thousands of people on a daily basis – from claim management to life-saving emergency calls, among other services. Define the standards and become a pioneer together with around 9000 associates worldwide.

Job Description

The Power Tools Division of the Bosch Group is the world market leader for power tools and power tool accessories. The Global Digital Unit is efficiently bundling digital activities across all Business Units of Bosch Power Tools.

- You will be part of an interdisciplinary team creating an IoT focussed App and the Cloud components for a platform

- You will be responsible for the development and operations of a microservice that mobile and web apps will use

- You will implement suitable messaging, storage mechanisms, and related items (data models, database choice and topologies, scaling foundation, etc.).

- Automate the deployment and operations of cloud infrastructure (Azure, Azure DevOps) by utilizing Infrastructure-as-Code

Qualifications

- At least 3 years of experience with Java and SpringBoot, ideally also Kotlin or other modern languages

- Professional experience in Agile software development & operations (DevOps mindset)

- Experience with SQL and no-SQL databases as well as messaging technologies (ideally Kafka)

- You love Cloud, IoT, and CI CD technologies and are familiar with Azure or AWS

- Cloud automation (Pulumi or Terraform) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus

- Fluent in English, both written and oral

- Willingness to travel and work as a part of an international team (for short periods, as required)

- And most important: have fun working with wonderful people on a diverse team

Additional Information

What we offer you: 

Challenges in an international environment | career opportunities in one of the best companies in the world | flexible hours | medical services | discounts for employees | sports and health related activities | canteen | good access to public transports | space for creativity.

Success stories don´t just happen. They are made...

Make it happen! We are looking forward to your application!

Software Engineer, Managed Service

At SingleStore, we're not just building a database company, we are defining the future of data management. Going beyond multi-cloud, we offer our customers flexible networking, storage and compute options to meet their requirements. They click a few options, and our service flies into action, using the latest capabilities of the big cloud providers and the industry-standard Kubernetes ecosystem to get the job done. This managed service helps make SingleStore an excellent choice for many of our customers.

We are looking for exceptional talent to help us push the boundaries of what’s possible with a managed database product. The next set of capabilities in the pipeline require overcoming difficult technical challenges in the areas of networking, control plane, and scaling services - inventing some of the future of what customers will come to expect from a managed database product.

As a part of the managed service team, you will design and implement new capabilities for our cloud offering involving deep extensions to our networking, control plane, and overall managed service. Your role will include working closely with our product teams to collaborate on meeting the needs of our most demanding long-time and new customers. In this role, you will be at the intersection of leading technology trends - A highly performant distributed database, managed by Kubernetes, running in the cloud. You will probably find yourself using Go and Kubernetes, with a generous sprinkling of whatever the right tool is for the job. We look forward to hearing from you!

Role and Responsibilities

Work closely with product managers, designers, customers, and other engineers to ensure we deliver a high-quality experienceDevelop a world-class managed service responsible for providing an innovative operational database solution in the cloudProactively contribute to the team's engineering process to assist with our ability to scale and deliver projects on timeMentor junior engineers and contribute to a welcoming team environment

Required Skills And Experience

Experience with working on distributed systems, ideally in programming languages such as Golang, Python or RustExperience working with Kubernetes and/or containerized services2+ years of experience working on a SaaS productIntellectual curiosity about investigating issues that impact business metricsPassion for building high-quality products that are robust and easy to maintain in a fast-paced, team-oriented environmentExperience working on product security features such as authentication, authorization, audit logging, or data protection. 

As employees are located in many different countries around the world, some benefits may differ from country to country. In all cases, we do our best to provide equitable perks and benefits across our locations.

SingleStore delivers the cloud-native database with the speed and scale to power the world’s data-intensive applications. With a distributed SQL database that introduces simplicity to your data architecture by unifying transactions and analytics, SingleStore empowers digital leaders to deliver exceptional, real-time data experiences to their customers. SingleStore is venture-backed and headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Sunnyvale, Raleigh, Seattle, Boston, London, Lisbon, Bangalore, Dublin and Kyiv.

Consistent with our commitment to diversity & inclusion, we value individuals with the ability to work on diverse teams and with a diverse range of people.

Please note that SingleStore’s COVID-19 vaccination policy requires that team members in the United States be up to date with the current CDC guidelines for their vaccinations with one of the United States FDA-approved vaccine options to meet in person for SingleStore business or to work from one of our U.S. office locations. [It is expected that this will be a requirement for this role]. If an exemption and/or accommodation to our vaccination policy is requested, a member of the Human Resources department will be available to begin the interactive accommodation process.

To all recruitment agencies: SingleStore does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to SingleStore employees. SingleStore is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company.

#remote-li

SingleStore values individuals for their unique skills and experiences, and we’re proud to offer roles in a variety of locations across the United States. Salary is based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location, and is just one part of our total compensation and benefits package. Certain roles are also eligible for additional rewards, including merit increases and annual bonuses.

Our benefits package for this role includes: stock options, flexible paid time off, monthly three-day weekends, 14 weeks of fully-paid gender-neutral parental leave, fertility and adoption assistance, mental health counseling, 401(k) retirement plan, and rich health insurance offerings—including medical, dental, vision and life and disability insurance.

For candidates residing in California, please see our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. For candidates residing in the EEA, UK, and Switzerland, please see our EEA, UK, and Swiss Recruitment Privacy Notice.

Create moments that matter. Decode the future.

At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.

Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.

Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!

All about the role:

As software is playing an increasingly significant role in enabling digital consumer experiences, we are gearing up to become more agile, faster in responding to market demands and quicker in identifying new market opportunities. This involves elevating our appliances to digital, software-defined products in a seamless integration of modular electronics, software, and connectivity platform.

We’re looking for Backend Developer to join us on our journey.

What you'll do:

The main role responsibility will be to develop IoT oriented services. Standing in this role you will have the chance to work on the kernel of the IoT system of Electrolux, the system that must be able to manage a huge number of devices and with extremely high level of reliability and performances. The full value chain of the IoT application flows and depends on the IoT Platform part therefore, standing in the centre of the IoT system, this role can leverage all the opportunity and challenges coming with that.

In detail, you will:

Working for Open CosmosAim high, go beyond!At Open Cosmos we are solving the world’s biggest challenges from space, providing businesses, governments and researchers access to more readily available information than ever before - ready for the challenge? Then read on…
Working in the Ground Segment TeamJoin our dynamic Ground SegmentTeam responsible for all of the on-ground software used to operate a fleet of Open Cosmos satellites. As a "new space" company, we embrace flexible agile development methodologies and DevOps practices.
Our cloud-native web application, OpenApp, is built with modern technologies like microservices, Kubernetes, and Go. Our image processing pipeline is built on a modern workflow system, with the jobs written in Python. You'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the product, from functionality to quality and maintainability. Join us and develop your skills in a modern cloud-based web application environment.
What will you be doing?As our software solutions, like our data platform DataCosmos, rapidly gain commercial traction, you’ll be responsible for delivering new software modules, through design, implementation, testing, deployment and maintenance, in addition to looking after existing services. Throughout this process, you’ll follow best practices for developing clean code and maintainable software and push for all the team to do the same.
You’ll have the opportunity to be involved in all points of the product development process, standing for yourself in the customer’s shoes and using that understanding to contribute to a roadmap & build software that leads to products that our customers love. Since we are always discovering new requirements for this software, you’ll be continually learning in order to deliver on those requirements.
In pursuit of our shared goal to keep improving, you’ll constantly be evaluating how we work & deliver to bring ideas/suggestions to the team - this can include e.g. platform & observability aspects for better reliability, streamlining our development & testing practices, or features/redesigns of the product itself.
What you need to be successfulAt Open Cosmos, we are more interested in what you can do than being dogmatic about your background! We’d love to take a look at your CV even if you’re not sure you tick all the boxes.
You’ll need: Program in the Go or Python programming language, including using common idioms of each language and testing frameworks. For Go, you should be familiar with goroutines and debugging race conditionsDesign, implement and maintain microservices using Docker, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, HTTP REST, gRPC and RabbitMQBuild and manage GitLab CI/CD pipelinesFollow best practices for developing maintainable and easy to understand software as well as in agile software development methodologiesCommunicate clearly and concisely, listening effectively, getting to the core of messages and responding appropriately
What we offer: Prefer to mostly WFH, that's fine! Need to take 30 mins at 3pm to get the kids from school? Go ahead! We're more interested in your contributions than when and where you're working.25 Days holiday in addition to national holidays.Having a successful team makes a successful company. We're at the forefront of technology so learning and building an enabling career for you is central to OC!

Software Engineer, Managed Service

At SingleStore, we're not just building a database company, we are defining the future of data management. Going beyond multi-cloud, we offer our customers flexible networking, storage and compute options to meet their requirements. They click a few options, and our service flies into action, using the latest capabilities of the big cloud providers and the industry-standard Kubernetes ecosystem to get the job done. This managed service helps make SingleStore an excellent choice for many of our customers.

We are looking for exceptional talent to help us push the boundaries of what’s possible with a managed database product. The next set of capabilities in the pipeline require overcoming difficult technical challenges in the areas of networking, control plane, and scaling services - inventing some of the future of what customers will come to expect from a managed database product.

As a part of the managed service team, you will design and implement new capabilities for our cloud offering involving deep extensions to our networking, control plane, and overall managed service. Your role will include working closely with our product teams to collaborate on meeting the needs of our most demanding long-time and new customers. In this role, you will be at the intersection of leading technology trends - A highly performant distributed database, managed by Kubernetes, running in the cloud. You will probably find yourself using Go and Kubernetes, with a generous sprinkling of whatever the right tool is for the job. We look forward to hearing from you!

Role and Responsibilities

Work closely with product managers, designers, customers, and other engineers to ensure we deliver a high-quality experienceDevelop a world-class managed service responsible for providing an innovative operational database solution in the cloudProactively contribute to the team's engineering process to assist with our ability to scale and deliver projects on timeMentor junior engineers and contribute to a welcoming team environment

Required Skills And Experience

Experience with working on distributed systems, ideally in programming languages such as Golang, Python or RustExperience working with Kubernetes and/or containerized services2+ years of experience working on a SaaS productIntellectual curiosity about investigating issues that impact business metricsPassion for building high-quality products that are robust and easy to maintain in a fast-paced, team-oriented environmentExperience working on product security features such as authentication, authorization, audit logging, or data protection. 

As employees are located in many different countries around the world, some benefits may differ from country to country. In all cases, we do our best to provide equitable perks and benefits across our locations.

SingleStore delivers the cloud-native database with the speed and scale to power the world’s data-intensive applications. With a distributed SQL database that introduces simplicity to your data architecture by unifying transactions and analytics, SingleStore empowers digital leaders to deliver exceptional, real-time data experiences to their customers. SingleStore is venture-backed and headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Sunnyvale, Raleigh, Seattle, Boston, London, Lisbon, Bangalore, Dublin and Kyiv.

Consistent with our commitment to diversity & inclusion, we value individuals with the ability to work on diverse teams and with a diverse range of people.

Please note that SingleStore’s COVID-19 vaccination policy requires that team members in the United States be up to date with the current CDC guidelines for their vaccinations with one of the United States FDA-approved vaccine options to meet in person for SingleStore business or to work from one of our U.S. office locations. [It is expected that this will be a requirement for this role]. If an exemption and/or accommodation to our vaccination policy is requested, a member of the Human Resources department will be available to begin the interactive accommodation process.

SingleStore is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with the Company.

Salary is based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location, and is just one part of our total compensation and benefits package. Certain roles are also eligible for additional rewards, including merit increases and annual bonuses.

Our benefits package for this role includes: stock options, flexible paid time off, monthly three-day weekends, 14 weeks of fully-paid gender-neutral parental leave, fertility and adoption assistance, mental health counseling, 401(k) retirement plan, and rich health insurance offerings—including medical, dental, vision and life and disability insurance.

Nous cherchons une personne dynamique, ambitieuse et passionnée par la vente pour un CDI de 35h par semaine.Un poste est à pourvoir aux Galeries Lafayette de Dijon Vos missions :Attirer et fidéliser une clientèle en leur offrant une expérience d'achat de qualité.Relever avec succès les challenges de vente en se basant sur les KPIs pour atteindre les objectifs définis.Assurer la bonne présentation du point de vente et mettre en avant nos produits.Respecter scrupuleusement nos valeurs, règles et procédures.Participer à la gestion rigoureuse du stock.Partager et transmettre votre passion pour la bijouterie auprès de vos clients et collègues.Collaborer activement au sein d'une équipe dynamique pour surmonter ensemble les challenges internes.

Chaos is the world’s largest 3D visualization software company, and for over 20 years has empowered artists, designers, and architects to visualize anything they can imagine. Chaos offers intuitive and powerful workflows for creatives across the entire design spectrum, including architecture, engineering, construction, product design, manufacturing, and media and entertainment. Research and development at Chaos is leading the way towards a truly comprehensive end-to-end visualization ecosystem to meet the evolving needs of existing and new customers. In 2022, Chaos merged with Enscape and acquired Cylindo. For more information, visit chaos.com, enscape3d.com, and cylindo.com.
Chaos Camp is Chaos’ annual programming academy for junior developers interested in gaining the coding knowledge and skills essential for a career in software development for computer graphics. The academy is organized in partnership with MNKnowledge - a trusted provider of educational services in the field of information technology.
***The program is open for applicants based in Bulgaria, Czechia, Denmark, and Germany. Although the training will be conducted online, the best-performing participants will have the opportunity to join the Chaos team, which will require on-site presence in our offices in these locations: Sofia, Bulgaria; Prague, Czechia; Copenhagen, Denmark; Karlsruhe, Germany.***
What we offer:Intensive 3.5-month free-of-charge online training focused on algorithms and data structures for C++ and computer graphics programming. The training sessions will be conducted in English, starting on April 2, 2024, and continuing until mid-July.Training and mentorship by lecturers from our partner MNKnowledge and senior professionals from the Chaos team.Chance to learn more about the software development world and 3D visualization by collaborating with members of the Chaos team.Certificate of Completion issued by Chaos, awarded upon the successful completion of the course (80%+ lectures attended, 80%+ homework assignments completed).Opportunity to become a part of the Chaos team and further develop your skills by receiving additional lectures in C++ algorithms and machine learning, as well as on-the-job training.
What do you need to successfully enroll in Chaos Camp?Working level of English (B1);Interest in mathematical algorithms and/or computer graphics;Relevant education/courses in the field of software development;Commitment to attend the training sessions and complete the homework assignments;Proactivity and passion for learning.
Don't miss the opportunity to participate in this year's edition of the Chaos Camp and send us your CV in English with attached/linked projects demonstrating your software development skills by March 17, 2024.
Please make sure you get familiar with our Privacy Policy before applying. (https://static.chaos.com/documents/assets/000/000/441/original/Privacy-Notice-Chaos-Engineering-Camp-2024.docx.pdf?1708520701)
Only short-listed candidates will be contacted via email to complete the entry test prior to the beginning of the course. The candidates with the highest score on the entry test will be invited to join the program.
Confidentiality of all applications is assured.

Welcome to Bosch

Cars drive autonomously, machines speak to each other, and houses become smarter. At Bosch, we turn these visions into reality to improve the quality of life for people all over the world. Start something big and become a part of forward thinkers where you can create something remarkable: Invented for life.

With over 300 specialized associates and around 15 nationalities, Bosch activities in Lisbon are focusing on sales, marketing, communication, training, nearshoring services and shared support for human resources services to Europe. The diversity, commitment and know-how of the team are the key success factors of this organization.

Bosch Service Solutions develops and delivers Customer Experience, Mobility and Monitoring solutions for companies and their customers. Our teams find fast and efficient solutions for thousands of people on a daily basis – from claim management to life-saving emergency calls, among other services. Define the standards and become a pioneer together with around 9000 associates worldwide.

Job Description

The Power Tools Division of the Bosch Group is the world market leader for power tools and power tool accessories. The Global Digital Unit is efficiently bundling digital activities across all Business Units of Bosch Power Tools.

- You will be part of an interdisciplinary team creating an IoT focussed App and the Cloud components for a platform

- You will be responsible for the development and operations of a microservice that mobile and web apps will use

- You will implement suitable messaging, storage mechanisms, and related items (data models, database choice and topologies, scaling foundation, etc.).

- Automate the deployment and operations of cloud infrastructure (Azure, Azure DevOps) by utilizing Infrastructure-as-Code

Qualifications

- At least 3 years of experience with Java and SpringBoot, ideally also Kotlin or other modern languages

- Professional experience in Agile software development & operations (DevOps mindset)

- Experience with SQL and no-SQL databases as well as messaging technologies (ideally Kafka)

- You love Cloud, IoT, and CI CD technologies and are familiar with Azure or AWS

- Cloud automation (Pulumi or Terraform) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus

- Fluent in English, both written and oral

- Willingness to travel and work as a part of an international team (for short periods, as required)

- And most important: have fun working with wonderful people on a diverse team

Additional Information

What we offer you: 

Challenges in an international environment | career opportunities in one of the best companies in the world | flexible hours | medical services | discounts for employees | sports and health related activities | canteen | good access to public transports | space for creativity.

Success stories don´t just happen. They are made...

Make it happen! We are looking forward to your application!

Reconocida como la empresa líder en desarrollo de software, nuestro cliente ofrece una modalidad 100% remota y un excelente entorno de trabajo donde los empleados pueden prosperar y trabajar en equipos multiculturales con horarios flexibles e infinitas oportunidades de crecimiento.
Acerca del puesto:
Únete a nuestro dinámico equipo como Líder Técnico Java y lidera la innovación en un entorno colaborativo. Mejorarás los servicios, las herramientas y los componentes dentro de un equipo de colaboración mediante la conducción de soluciones ágiles para los desafíos internos y externos, garantizando una calidad de software de primera categoría. Conviértete en una pieza clave de nuestro equipo central, utilizando tecnologías modernas para dar forma a los artefactos y apoyar a diversos grupos, todo ello garantizando que nuestro software alcance nuevas cotas de excelencia.
Responsabilidades:
- Crear código eficiente, optimizado y mantenible utilizando Java.- Proponer soluciones creativas empleando múltiples tecnologías.- Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinares para diseñar arquitecturas en la nube utilizando Azure y Kubernetes, garantizando un despliegue fluido de las aplicaciones.- Garantizar el rendimiento de las aplicaciones estableciendo mecanismos de supervisión y alerta.- Aprovechar la arquitectura en la nube para diseñar e integrar API en un entorno de integración continua y revisión de código.- Dirigir y orientar a los desarrolladores junior.
Requisitos:
- Más de 5 años de experiencia en desarrollo Java.- Dominio de AWS.- Experiencia demostrada en el diseño de soluciones en la nube y la integración de servicios distribuidos.- Familiaridad con tecnologías de monitorización y alertas.- Experiencia con modelos de integración continua y revisión de código.- Gran capacidad de resolución de problemas.- Tener fluidez en español.- Nivel medio de inglés.
Beneficios:
- 100% trabajo a distancia.- Horario flexible - ¡haz tu propio horario!- Entorno de trabajo diverso y multicultural.- Permiso parental retribuido, vacaciones y festivos.- Hardware preparado para trabajar desde casa. - Excelente remuneración, muy por encima de la media del mercado.- Amplias oportunidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional gracias a nuestro sistema de mentores.
Disfrute de la oportunidad de tener un estilo de vida dinámico, mejor salud y bienestar. Encuentre una pasión renovada en su trabajo, mejore su productividad y benefíciese de atractivas oportunidades de crecimiento para su carrera profesional.
Si estás interesado en formar parte de un equipo compuesto por los mejores profesionales y trabajar 100% orientado a objetivos en un entorno innovador, pero con la estructura y los recursos de una multinacional líder en el mercado, ¡no dudes en presentar tu candidatura!

description.text:
Dlaczego My?Jesteśmy częścią grupy ALTEN – wiodącego, europejskiego dostawcy usług doradztwa inżynieryjnego i technologicznego. W ciągu 30 lat staliśmy się głównym partnerem technologicznym wielu globalnych klientów, zatrudniając przy tym ponad 42 000 pracowników (w tym 88% inżynierów), w 30 krajach na całym świecie. Wspieramy strategie rozwoju swoich klientów w dziedzinie innowacji, badań i rozwoju oraz systemów informatycznych, osiągając przychody przekraczające 2,92 mld euro.Zostaliśmy wyróżnieni tytułem Great Place to Work 2023 oraz nagrodą „Rzecznik Standardu Etyki” przyznawaną przez United Nations Global Compact Network Poland.
Nasza dewiza to – „You Grow, We Grow!”Dołącz do ALTEN Polska i rośnij razem z nami!
Twoje zadaniaBudowanie, testowanie i wdrażanie oprogramowania przy użyciu CI/CDTworzenie mikroserwisów do przetwarzania danych, odczytu/zapisu do bazy danychWykorzystywanie wzorców architektonicznychTestowanie oprogramowania pod kątem funkcjonalności, jakości, wydajności i skalowalności
Nasze wymaganiaDostępność ASAP/2 tygodniePraca hybrydowa w Warszawie (3 dni z biura, 2 dni zdalnie)Ponad 3 letnie doświadczenie jako Fullstack Java + ReactDoświadczenie w rozwoju mikroserwisów w chmurze Azure.Znajomość baz danych MongoDB oraz PostgreSQL
OferujemyMożliwość wyboru rodzaju kontraktu: B2B lub umowa o pracęStabilną i długoterminową współpracęJasno zdefiniowaną ścieżkę kariery u europejskiego lidera w doradztwie inżynieryjnym i ITUdział w konferencjach branżowych, szkoleniach i warsztatach oraz spotkaniach integracyjnychMożliwość odbycia kursów i zdobycia certyfikacjiMożliwość relokacji w ramach lokalnych oddziałów ALTEN PolskaWspółpracę z dedykowanym Business Development ManageremPracę w firmie z certyfikatem #GreatPlaceToWork
BenefityPrywatna opieka medyczna MedicoverPrywatna opieka dentystyczna MedicoverPlatforma zakupowa Medicover Benefits / karta sportowa MedicoverProgram poleceń pracowników ALTEN TalentyDostęp do platformy e-learningowejWyprawka dla nowonarodzonego dziecka pracownikaUbezpieczenie grupowe na życieMożliwość udziału w programie emerytalnymNie czekaj i dołącz do naszego zespołu!UWAGA: Uprzejmie informujemy, że skontaktujemy się z wybranymi osobami.

BindingFuture, azienda del Gruppo Teoresi, è specializzata nello sviluppo software e consulenza informatica.Realizziamo soluzioni software personalizzate per conto dei nostri Clienti, in ambito web, cloud, mobile, desktop, IoT, bot e assistenti vocali. 
BindingFuture è alla ricerca di un giovane Software Developer, orientato allo sviluppo sulla piattaforma Microsoft .NET. 
La persona selezionata verrà inserita in un gruppo di lavoro fortemente orientato all'innovazione e si occuperà di progetti di sviluppo variegati per settore e tecnologia impiegata.
Requisiti richiesti: • Laurea in ambito informatico o esperienza equivalente • Seniority: 1/2 anni • Passione e interesse per lo sviluppo in ambiente .NET 
Skill tecniche: • C# • Framework .NET • ASP.NET Core • SQL • Git 
Completano il profilo: • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese • Entusiasmo per la tecnologia BindingFuture offre: • Percorsi di certificazione Microsoft • Supporto per lo studio e il conseguimento degli esami Microsoft • Possibilità di lavorare in progetti e tecnologie di vario tipo
Il candidato potrà evolvere le proprie competenze su tecnologie che normalmente utilizziamo, ovvero: • Cloud Azure • Microservices • Docker • Kubernetes • Xamarin • MAUI • Blazor • NoSQL 
La sede di lavoro è Milano/Cologno Monzese con alta flessibilità per il remote working.
Si informano i candidati che, inviando la candidatura, tutti i dati verranno trattati secondo quanto previsto dalla nostra informativa privacy, visionabile al seguente link https://www.teoresigroup.com/privacy-notice-recruitment/.

description.text: Dausinger + Giesen GmbH entwickelt und baut gepulste Hochleistungslaser mit Pulsdauer von Subpiko- bis Nanosekundenpulsdauer basierend auf der von unserem Gründer und Gesellschafter Adolf Giesen erfundenen Scheibenlasertechnologie. Scheibenlaser werden weltweit in großer Zahl für Forschung und in der industriellen Produktion eingesetzt.Wir sind ein kleines motiviertes Team und bieten flexible Arbeitszeiten in kooperativem Betriebsklima an. Der Arbeitsplatz liegt im Herzen Stuttgarts und ist gut mit öffentlichen und privaten Verkehrsmitteln zu erreichen.Wenn Sie es lieben, ganzheitlich zu arbeiten und die weitgefächerte Arbeitsteilung größerer Betriebe eher weniger schätzen sind Sie bei uns richtig.Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehört:· Mechanisches Design der Lasersysteme und Komponenten· Erstellung der technischen Dokumentation · Kommunikation mit Zulieferer · Zusammenbau / Betreuung des Zusammenbaus von Prototypen · Korrektur der Design-/Fertigungs-/Zusammenbaufehler· Weitere Aufgaben im Bereich der Optikmontage Ihr bevorzugtes Profil:· Techniker- oder Ingenieurausbildung· Praktische Erfahrung im Bereich Mechanik vom Vorteil· Kenntnisse / Erfahrung im Bereich Optik oder Laser vom Vorteil · Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse für Arbeitskommunikation

Who we areAllot is an industry leader in network security and visibility. A global growing company in cyber-security with a strong Tier1 customer base. We embrace an Agile way of working, priding ourselves on being fast, diverse and dynamic. We are real team players who are ready to go the extra mile to succeed. We believe that anyone can make an impact and together our team spirit makes all the difference. This is your opportunity to develop, professionally and personally.
What we are looking forAllot Software Engineers develop the next-generation technologies that secure and monitor the network.Our products need to handle network traffic even fully encrypted.We are looking for talented engineer who bring high motivation and desire to and work as software developers together with our research team to help improving our infrastructure for our AI.This position will start as a temporary project for 6-9 months with possibility to expend. It will be given the option for a temporary contract or university agreement.
What you will doYou will work together with our research team to improve the infrastructure and optimize the data collection as an input for our AI models.You will build the tool to collect, clean and process this information.
What you should haveDegree in Computer Science or TelecommunicationsHighly motivated team player with great collaboration skills.Great written & verbal communication skills.Some understanding of network architecture and protocols.Experience in design and coding with Python.Experience with Linux OS environment.

Wir bei wehorse.com möchten jedem die Möglichkeit geben, sich von überall auf der Welt rund um das Thema Pferd und Pferdesport weiterzubilden. 
Unsere Vision ist es, Menschen und Pferden dabei zu helfen, besser zu werden – mit den besten Trainern und mit erstklassigen Inhalten, die gleichzeitig Spaß machen und durch gute Erklärungen wirklich funktionieren. 
Eine Reitstunde mit Olympiasiegerin Ingrid Klimke oder ein paar Tipps von Lisa Röckener zur Freiarbeit sind bei uns an der Tagesordnung. Auf unserer Web- und Mobile-App finden neben hunderten videobasierten Onlinekursen auch regelmäßige Livestreaming-Events statt, sowie Deutschlands größter Pferdepodcast. 
Die Videos und Video-Kurse sind das Herzstück unseres Produkts. Du möchtest Videos und Kurse konzipieren, umsetzen und in der Postproduktion zu einem fertigen Produkt werden lassen, das von tausenden Menschen monatlich verwendet wird? Du hast Lust, mit uns neue Content-Formate zu entwickeln und du hast die neuesten Trends im Blick? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams und hilf uns dabei, coole Inhalte für Pferdemenschen zu erstellen, die ihnen dabei helfen, mit ihren Pferden besser zu werden.
Was sind deine Aufgaben?
Umsetzung von Content-Projekten im Bereich Lehrvideos und EdutainmentKonzeption und Erstellung hochwertiger Videos und Texte für unsere unterschiedlichen Content-Typen (Shorts, Kurse, SuperKurse und weitere) Postproduktion (Videos, Podcasts etc.) inklusive VideoschnittEnge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Marketing- und Social Media-Team, um sicherzustellen, dass der Content die Unternehmensziele unterstütztAnalyse von Content-Performance-Daten zur kontinuierlichen Optimierung der Content-StrategieAktives Beobachten von Trends im Bereich Video-Creation und Social Media, um neue Ideen und Ansätze zu integrieren
Stellenanforderungen
Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Medien und Kommunikation (Medienmanagement, Bewegtbild, Medienproduktion, Social Media etc.) oder vergleichbare AusbildungIdealerweise Berufserfahrung in der Content-Erstellung oder in einem verwandten BereichSicherer Umgang mit den gängigen Tools wie Adobe Premiere Pro, Capcut oder ähnlichenPferdewissen und Passion für Themen rund ums Pferd, idealerweise selbst Reiter*inHohe Affinität für soziale Medien und Trends im Bereich Content CreationStarkes Gespür für Qualität in Text und BildspracheLiebe fürs Detail aber auch die Fähigkeit, pragmatisch zu denken und zu handelnAusgezeichnete Schreib- und KommunikationsfähigkeitenKreativität und InnovationsfreudeTeamfähigkeit und FlexibilitätIdealerweise Englisch fließend in Sprache und Schrift
Es handelt sich um eine Vollzeit-Stelle (40h/Woche), die du grundsätzlich von überall antreten kannst. Du musst nicht zwangsläufig in Hamburg wohnen. Allerdings gibt es gewisse Zeiten im Büro, bei denen es wichtig ist, dass du präsent bist. Der Einstieg ist ab sofort möglich.

Nimble One is a robotic startup, located in Toulouse, France.
We are looking for a Lead electronic engineer to lead the electrical engineering team as we bring Aru's electronic into its industrialisation phase.This is a high profile position where you'll be expected to add critical value to the project. Therefore a relocation package is available as well as stock options.
We are building Aru, a novel mobile robot capable of advanced interactions. Aru is made for challenging terrains, constrained and tight spaces, with its main goal being to bring the right tool at the right place, where other robots cannot go.
With the recent reveal of our pre-series prototype Aru V3, we are starting our next an biggest challenge yet : Industrialization and field deployments as part of our early-adopter program.As part of this, we are expanding our platform team with several key roles.
As lead electronic engineer, the technical challenges you'll be managing :PCBs with high-tech communication protocols : Ethercat, Ethernet, USB, ...PCBs with advanced electronics : fiber optics, acurate distributed sensors, slip rings ...Custom sub-assemblies where a smart system design is key : Custom actuator and controller boards, ...(Depending on skills & preferences) Embedded firmware : motor control, distributed computations, ...
As well as dedicated mission tools that must embedded well into the modular structure of Aru to specialize for each use-case. Which will entail a large amount of custom mechanical, electrical and firmware engineering.
We are looking for someone with more than 10 years of experience. Like all jobs at Nimble One, this is a hands-on job where you'll design, source and order, prototype, debug and improve the projects you are working on, as part of a larger team. 
You want to build a unprecedented robot with world class functionality, full of state of the art technology ? That's Aru, by Nimble One.
